text:
I create ResultSet object in servlet and save it in requests scope: PreparedStatement pstmt; ... ResultSet searchResults = pstmt.executeQuery(); request.setAttribute("searchResults", searchResults); Then in jsp:
It works fine, if searchResults has any records. If searchResults is empty, then once again will be output the result from the previous call to . I have already made changes in my local copy of ResultSetTag.java to fix this problem and it works. If you interested, I can mail you my changes. Good luck.
creator: ttor@ukr.net

text:
Hmm, that looks like a container caching problem, similar to bug belo (on <c:out>):


http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26320
creator: nagoya@felipeal.net

text:
Yes, this is the bug I've reported long ago:
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=16830. I've even created a
fix, but noone seems to care.
creator: tivv@gtech-ua.com
nagoya@felipeal.net
text:
Ok, I did a fix similar to that one mentioned on bug 26320: I'm calling
super.bodyContent = null at doStartTag().

Is that the fix you have in mind?

Created attachment 10555
JSP page that reproduces the error (must have hsqldb.jar on WEB-INF/lib)
creator: nagoya@felipeal.net
nagoya@felipeal.net
